sprint_goal: Establish core architecture, secure authentication, a full DICOM ingestion pipeline, and mitigate viewer risk.
epic_coverage: Core Architecture, User Authentication, DICOM Services (Initial), DICOM Viewer (Spike)
key_deliverables: Runnable WPF Client & Windows Service shells; Secure user login; DICOM C-STORE SCP listener; DirectX interop prototype.
demo_objectives: 1. Demonstrate successful login with Admin and Technician roles. 2. Show UI elements hiding/showing based on role. 3. Send a DICOM study from a test tool and show it being received by the service. 4. Showcase the DirectX prototype window.
success_criteria: All foundational services are built and tested; Login is functional; DirectX prototype proves viability.
risk_factors: RISK-001: High complexity of DirectX interop. RISK-005: HIPAA compliance risks in authentication and logging.
mitigation_strategies: Prioritize the DirectX technical spike (TASK-4001) to get an early go/no-go. Conduct thorough peer reviews on all security-related code.
external_dependencies: Availability of PostgreSQL, RabbitMQ, and DICOM test tools.
integration_windows: Continuous integration testing throughout the sprint.
burndown_target: Complete 50% of hours by end of day 5.

sprint_goal: Deliver functional DICOM viewer, printing, and admin monitoring.
epic_coverage: DICOM Services (Final), DICOM Viewer, Printing, Administration
key_deliverables: Fully interactive DICOM viewer; Asynchronous printing workflow; System health dashboard.
demo_objectives: 1. Open a DICOM study and demonstrate zoom, pan, and interactive window/level. 2. Submit a print job and show the UI remaining responsive. 3. Show the job being processed and sent to a printer. 4. Demonstrate the system health dashboard reflecting live system status.
success_criteria: DICOM viewer is performant and functional; Print jobs are processed successfully; Health dashboard accurately reflects component status.
risk_factors: RISK-001: Potential stability issues with DirectX viewer. RISK-007: DICOM compatibility with vendor-specific files.
mitigation_strategies: Allocate buffer time for viewer stabilization and bug fixing. Begin building a diverse DICOM test file library.
external_dependencies: Access to physical or virtual printers for testing.
integration_windows: Integration of viewer into main application on day 3-4. Print E2E testing on day 7-8.
burndown_target: Linear burndown with 50% completion by day 5.
